article.simpara: Use the dfx ledger command to interact with the ledger canister.
This command can be used to make ICP utlity token transactions from one to another, or top up canisters with cycles from ICP.
The basic syntax for running dfx ledger commands is:

Depending on the dfx ledger subcommand you specify, additional arguments, options, and flags might apply. For reference information and examples that illustrate using dfx ledger commands, select an appropriate command.

Prints the account balance of the user.
Creates a canister from ICP.

Notifies the ledger when there is a send transaction to the cycles minting canister.

section.title: dfx ledger account-id
section.simpara: Use the dfx ledger account-id command to display the account identifier associated with the currently-active identity. Like the textual representation of your developer identity principal, the account identifier is derived from your private key and used to represent your identity in the ledger canister.

section.title: dfx ledger create-canister
section.simpara: Use the dfx ledger create-canister command to convert ICP tokens to cycles and to register a new canister identifier on the {IC}.

section.title: Flags
section.simpara: You can use the following optional flags with the dfx ledger create-canister command.

entry.simpara: -h, --help
Displays usage information.
-V, --version
Displays version information.

section.title: Arguments
section.simpara: You can specify the following argument for the dfx ledger create-canister command.

entry.simpara: Specifies the principal identifier to set as the controller of the new canister.

section.title: Options
section.simpara: You can specify the following argument for the dfx ledger create-canister command.

entry.simpara: Specify the number of ICP tokens to mint into cycles and deposit into destination canister. You can specify an amount as a number with up to eight (8) decimal places.

Specify ICP token fractional units—called e8s—as a whole number, where one e8 is smallest partition of an ICP token. For example, 1.05000000 is 1 ICP and 5000000 e8s. You can use this option on its own or in conjunction with the --icp option.
Specify a transaction fee. The default is 10000 e8s.
Specify ICP tokens as a whole number. You can use this option on its own or in conjunction with --e8s.
Specify a maximum transaction fee. The default is 10000 e8s.

section.title: dfx ledger notify
section.simpara: Use the dfx ledger notify command to notify the ledger about a send transaction to the cycles minting canister. This command should only be used if dfx ledger create-canister or dfx ledger top-up successfully sent a message to the ledger, and a transaction was recorded at some block height, but for some reason the subsequent notify failed.

section.title: Flags
section.simpara: You can use the following optional flags with the dfx ledger notify command.

entry.simpara: -h, --help
Displays usage information.
-V, --version
Displays version information.

section.title: Arguments
section.simpara: You can specify the following argument for the dfx ledger notify command.

entry.simpara: Specifies the block height at which the send transaction was recorded.

Specifies the principal of the destination, either a canister identifier or the textual representation of a user principal. If the send transaction was for the create-canister command, specify the controller principal. If the send transaction was for the top-up command, specify the canister ID.

section.title: dfx ledger top-up
section.simpara: Use the dfx ledger top-up command to top up a canister with cycles minted from ICP tokens.

section.title: Flags
section.simpara: You can use the following optional flags with the dfx ledger top-up command.

entry.simpara: -h, --help
Displays usage information.
-V, --version
Displays version information.

section.title: Arguments
section.simpara: You can specify the following argument for the dfx ledger top-up command.

entry.simpara: Specifies the canister identifier that you would like to top up.

section.title: Options
section.simpara: You can specify the following options for the dfx ledger top-up command.

entry.simpara: Specifies the number of ICP tokens to mint into cycles and deposit into the destination canister. You can specify the amount as a number with up to eight (8) decimal places.

Specifies fractional units of an ICP token—called e8s—as a whole number, where one e8 is the smallest unit of an ICP token. For example, 1.05000000 is 1 ICP and 5000000 e8s. You can use this option on its own or in conjunction with the --icp option.
Specifies the transaction fee for the operation. The default is 10000 e8s.
Specifies ICP tokens as a whole number. You can use this option on its own or in conjunction with --e8s.
Specifies a maximum transaction fee. The default is 10000 e8s.

section.title: Examples
section.simpara: You can use the dfx ledger top-up command to top up the cycles of a specific canister from the balance of ICP tokens you control. The canister identifier must be associated with a cycles wallet canister that is able to receive cycles. Alternatively, you can modify a non-cycles wallet canister to implement a method to receive cycles using system APIs described in the Internet Computer Interface Specification.

section.title: dfx ledger transfer
section.simpara: Use the dfx ledger transfer command to transfer ICP tokens from your account address in the ledger canister to a destination address.

section.title: Flags
section.simpara: You can use the following optional flags with the dfx ledger transfer command.

entry.simpara: -h, --help
Displays usage information.
-V, --version
Displays version information.

section.title: Arguments
section.simpara: You can specify the following argument for the dfx ledger transfer command.

entry.simpara: Specify the Account Identifier or address to which you want to transfer ICP tokens.

section.title: Options
section.simpara: You can specify the following argument for the dfx ledger transfer command.

entry.simpara: Specifies the number of ICP tokens to transfer. Can be specified as a number with up to eight (8) decimal places.

Specifies e8s as a whole number, where one e8 is smallest partition of an ICP token. For example, 1.05000000 is 1 ICP and 5000000 e8s. You can use this option alone or in conjunction with the --icp option.
Specifies a transaction fee. The default is 10000 e8s.
Specifies ICP as a whole number. You can use this option alone or in conjunction with --e8s.
Specifies a numeric memo for this transaction.
